column5: Hey OFC, been a long time since I've posted a report but here it goes. I went back north of Kingston to my favourite lakes for a vacation with my family. We rented a small cottage on the lake and it was great. Friday was a rainy start to the trip but it did stop raining later in the evening. Fishing was slow for me to say the least. I was there from Friday afternoon to Monday morning, got out twice a day and had a great trip.  Here are some pictures from the trip, here is a picture of a double header my brother and I had.   Catching a small bass working shoreline.   Another one but on a senko   Here is a cool picture my mom got while I caught a chunky bass working edges with plastics.   And the fish   The next two pictures are of my brother and the other is my uncle who I visited while down for the weekend. My brother caught this bass as the first fish of the trip. Let's say, he beat his brother at his own game and he made sure he knew  he was in the lead   Later in the day my uncle and I got out for a few hours, here is a picture of a nice Pike he caught bring a frog across pads across the channel   Nice chunky fish I nailed on isolated pads   Big bass of the trip   The  next morning was very cold so I fished slow with tubes and senkos mostly. It was honestly a 1 bite morning with my brother for the 2hrs we were out before breakfast and this great bass hit, great fight a mile out.    Another skinny Pike I caught by surprise   Last fish of the trip, caught it off the bank the evening before we left   Thanks for looking everybody, might be back for a weekend in 2 or 3 weeks. MTBF
Good stuff, Mike. Great pics too...thanks for posting your report.
Great report! Love the colour of the water there, pitch black.
Nicely done man, lovin that slop there  Thanks for sharing!
Great report Mike ! Some real beauties there for sure:Gonefishing:
Yep,love the slop.  Nice report Mike.

The slop is pretty but didn't produce many fish for the weekend, fish came from the edges and pads mostly...some off shore fishing with tubes too but August is the time for the topwater bite in the slop there. The "black" water is actually quite clear but due to the deep drops and dark bottom is makes every where look so darn "fishy".  Thanks for the reply's guys.
EDIT!! Can't believe I forgot this picture, big fish of the trip  First thing in the morning dragging a worm....got 1 bite before breakfast and this was it haha, great fight.
Nice bass Mike, those largies look so prestine!
Nice report and fish Mike, love the look of that water you are fishing!	SWEET!
